section.title: Navigation Bar
section.para: The Editor allows the ability to modify content, create content, view content, create versions, and export content. One of the areas to access these functions is in the navigation bar.

mediaobject.alt: Figure of the Knowledge Editor navigation displaying the Editor logo, and menu options for Projects, Export Management, Authoring, Manager, and User name Admin

section.para:
The navigation bar provides the following options:
Projects - If your account has more than one project assigned, switch between them by selecting this menu item.
Shortcuts - Used for multiple actions that can be found in tab-specific areas of the application.
Manager - this option takes you to the Knowledge Manager Homepage. For the content editor and manager, account settings can be modified here; for the admin, user permissions and info are located here.
User - the menu under the user's name provides the ability to update global settings, manage account, and to log out.

section.title: Projects
section.para: This menu displays the projects that a user is assigned to. The user can switch between projects with this menu option as long as there is more than one project assgined, and the Knowledge environment they are working in has more than one project defined. The default is to have one project per Knowledge instance.

section.title: Shortcuts
section.para:
The shortcuts submenu provides a quick way for the user to access certain actions. These include:
New concept – to create a new concept.
New map set – to create a new map set.
New value set – to create a new value set.
Run classifier – performs a classification run.
Export content – displays the export content modal.
Create a version – displays the create a version modal.
Run QA test – performs a quality assurance check.
Shortcuts Menu
All of these actions can be performed by going through the shortcut menu or through features within specific tabs and panels in the task pane, refer to .

section.title: Manager
section.para: The Manager option is only available to an Administrator or System Manager administrator. If selected the user will be taken to the Knowledge Manager area. Here a user with the appropriate permissions can modify user accounts, create new accounts, etc. for more details refer to

section.title: Username Menu
section.para:
The menu under the user's name provides the ability to modify global settings, manage your account, view the user guide, and log out. Global settings contain filters and customizations for how you want to view the content. Manage account takes you to the Manager portal of Knowledge, where your profile and login information can be modified.
Global Display Settings – a user can specify information that is displayed
Manage Account – a user can modify their account information
Help – user documentation for Knowledge
Logout – signs you out of Knowledge

section.title: Global Display Options
section.para: Global display options enables the user to customize the information that is seen throughout the Knowledge application. For example: uncheck Show Only Active Concepts and select the apply button. The Inactive concepts and descriptions will display, see .
